page.title: 19BUILDINGS
page.content: {The first school}was built in 1939 at Three Lane Ends.It was designed by Oliver Hill and was ready to open in 1941.Mr.Hill was a lover of ships so he designed the school curved so it looked like a ship.He put 2 portholes in the doors,a high one for adults to look through and a low one for children.A man called Mr.Taylor had the idea of building this school.It cost Â£26000 altogether to build.2 Londoners designed a pattern of horses and bison on the outer wall.It is the only school of its kind. {Whitwood Terrace}was built in 1908 by Henry Briggs & Son for deputies and undermanagers,surveyors,and clerical workers at Whitwood Colliery.The architect was Mr.Voycey.In the terrace there are 19 houses plus the institute which is now a public house.
